stories.name: Partially Specified Project
stories.description: Project with some content generated, showing Continue Spec button. Displays request, PRD, and design brief tabs with content.

GET /api/projects/0001-ecommerce-platfor.request:
# Project Request

Build a modern e-commerce platform that allows users to browse products, manage their cart, and complete purchases securely.

## Key Features
- Product catalog with search and filtering
- Shopping cart functionality
- User authentication and profiles
- Order management system
- Payment processing integration
GET /api/projects/0001-ecommerce-platfor.prd:
# Product Requirements Document

## Overview
This document outlines the requirements for building a comprehensive e-commerce platform.

## Job Stories

### As a shopper
- When I visit the homepage, I want to see featured products so that I can discover new items
- When I search for products, I want to filter by category and price so that I can find what I'm looking for
- When I add items to my cart, I want to see the total price update so that I know how much I'm spending

## Requirements
1. Product catalog must support at least 1000 products
2. Cart must persist across sessions
3. Checkout flow must be completable in under 2 minutes
GET /api/projects/0001-ecommerce-platfor.acceptanceCriteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

### Product Browsing
- Given I am on the homepage
- When I view the product catalog
- Then I should see at least 12 products per page

### Shopping Cart
- Given I have items in my cart
- When I navigate to the cart page
- Then I should see all items with quantities and prices
GET /api/projects/0001-ecommerce-platfor.design:
# Design Brief

## Screen Inventory

### Primary Screens
1. **Homepage** - Hero section, featured products, category navigation
2. **Product Listing** - Grid view with filters and sorting
3. **Product Detail** - Product images, description, add to cart
4. **Shopping Cart** - Item list, quantities, checkout button
5. **Checkout** - Shipping info, payment, order summary

## User Flows
- Browse → View Product → Add to Cart → Checkout
- Search → Filter → View Product → Purchase

stories.name: Fully Specified with Issues
stories.description: All phases complete and approved, with issues generated. Shows View Issues button.

GET /api/projects/0002-task-management.request:
# Project Request

Build a collaborative task management application for teams.
GET /api/projects/0002-task-management.prd:
# Product Requirements Document

## Overview
A task management system that enables teams to collaborate effectively.

## Job Stories
- When I create a task, I want to assign it to a team member so that work is distributed
- When I view my dashboard, I want to see my assigned tasks so that I know what to work on

## Requirements
1. Support multiple projects and workspaces
2. Real-time updates for task status changes
3. File attachments and comments on tasks
GET /api/projects/0002-task-management.acceptanceCriteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

### Task Creation
- Given I am a project member
- When I create a new task
- Then it should appear in the project task list

### Task Assignment
- Given I have created a task
- When I assign it to a team member
- Then they should receive a notification
GET /api/projects/0002-task-management.design:
# Design Brief

## Screen Inventory
1. Dashboard - Overview of tasks and projects
2. Project View - Task board with columns
3. Task Detail - Full task information and comments
4. User Profile - Settings and preferences
GET /api/projects/0002-task-management.screens:
## Screen Specifications

### Dashboard Screen
- Header with user avatar and notifications
- Project cards grid
- Recent activity feed
- Quick action buttons
GET /api/projects/0002-task-management.tech:
# Technical Specification

## Architecture
- Frontend: React with TypeScript
- Backend: Node.js with Express
- Database: PostgreSQL
- Real-time: WebSocket connections

## Data Models
- User, Project, Task, Comment, Attachment

## API Endpoints
- GET /api/projects
- POST /api/tasks
- PUT /api/tasks/:id
GET /api/projects/0002-task-management.techChoices:
# Technology Choices

## Frontend Framework
1. **React 18** - Modern UI library with hooks
2. **Next.js** - Full-stack framework with SSR
3. **Vite** - Fast build tool

## State Management
1. **Zustand** - Lightweight state management
2. **React Query** - Server state management

## Recommendation: React 18 with Zustand

issues_list.title: Create task board component with drag-and-drop
Design and implement user profile page

stories.name: Fully Specified Without Issues
stories.description: All phases complete and approved, but no issues created yet. Shows Create Issues button.

GET /api/projects/0003-analytics-dashboa.request:
# Project Request

Create an analytics dashboard for tracking user engagement and business metrics.
GET /api/projects/0003-analytics-dashboa.prd:
# Product Requirements Document

## Overview
A comprehensive analytics platform for monitoring key business metrics.

## Job Stories
- When I view the dashboard, I want to see key metrics at a glance
- When I need details, I want to drill down into specific metrics

## Requirements
1. Real-time data updates
2. Customizable widgets
3. Export functionality
GET /api/projects/0003-analytics-dashboa.acceptanceCriteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

### Dashboard View
- Given I am logged in
- When I view the dashboard
- Then I should see all configured widgets

### Metric Details
- Given I am viewing a metric widget
- When I click on it
- Then I should see detailed breakdown
GET /api/projects/0003-analytics-dashboa.design:
# Design Brief

## Screen Inventory
1. Main Dashboard - Grid of metric widgets
2. Metric Detail - Expanded view with charts
3. Settings - Widget configuration
GET /api/projects/0003-analytics-dashboa.screens:
## Screen Specifications

### Dashboard Screen
- Responsive grid layout
- Widget cards with charts
- Date range selector
- Export button
GET /api/projects/0003-analytics-dashboa.tech:
# Technical Specification

## Architecture
- Frontend: React with D3.js for charts
- Backend: Python FastAPI
- Database: TimescaleDB for time-series data
- Caching: Redis

## Data Models
- Metric, Widget, Dashboard, User

## API Endpoints
- GET /api/metrics
- GET /api/dashboards
- POST /api/widgets
GET /api/projects/0003-analytics-dashboa.techChoices:
# Technology Choices

## Charting Library
1. **D3.js** - Powerful but complex
2. **Chart.js** - Simple and easy to use
3. **Recharts** - React-specific, declarative

## Recommendation: Recharts for React integration

GET /api/projects/0001-ecommerce-platfor.request:
# Project Request

Build a modern e-commerce platform that allows users to browse products, manage their cart, and complete purchases securely.

## Key Features
- Product catalog with search and filtering
- Shopping cart functionality
- User authentication and profiles
- Order management system
- Payment processing integration

## Success Criteria
- Support 10,000+ concurrent users
- Page load time under 2 seconds
- 99.9% uptime

stories.name: Technology Choices Tab
stories.description: Project showing the Technology Choices tab with selection interface.

GET /api/projects/0005-mobile-app.request:
# Project Request

Build a mobile application for iOS and Android.
GET /api/projects/0005-mobile-app.techChoices:
# Technology Choices

## Mobile Framework

1. **React Native**
   - Pros: Cross-platform, large community, hot reload
   - Cons: Performance limitations for complex animations
   - Recommendation: Best for rapid development

2. **Flutter**
   - Pros: Excellent performance, beautiful UI, single codebase
   - Cons: Dart language learning curve, larger app size
   - Recommendation: Best for performance-critical apps

3. **Native (Swift/Kotlin)**
   - Pros: Best performance, full platform access
   - Cons: Requires separate codebases, longer development time
   - Recommendation: Best for platform-specific features

## State Management

1. **Redux** - Predictable state container
2. **MobX** - Simple and scalable
3. **Zustand** - Lightweight and modern

GET /api/projects/0006-design-system.request:
# Project Request

Create a comprehensive design system.
GET /api/projects/0006-design-system.screens:
## Screen Specifications

### Homepage
- Header: Logo, navigation menu, user avatar
- Hero: Large banner with CTA button
- Features: Three-column grid with icons
- Footer: Links and copyright

### Product Page
- Breadcrumb navigation
- Product gallery (left)
- Product info (right)
- Related products section

### Checkout
- Step indicator (1/3)
- Shipping form
- Order summary sidebar
- Continue button

stories.name: Acceptance Criteria Tab
stories.description: Project showing the Acceptance Criteria tab with editable content.

GET /api/projects/0007-api-platform.request:
# Project Request

Build a RESTful API platform.
GET /api/projects/0007-api-platform.acceptanceCriteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

### API Authentication
- Given I am an unauthenticated user
- When I make an API request
- Then I should receive a 401 Unauthorized response

- Given I have a valid API key
- When I include it in the Authorization header
- Then I should receive a successful response

### Rate Limiting
- Given I am making API requests
- When I exceed 100 requests per minute
- Then I should receive a 429 Too Many Requests response

### Error Handling
- Given I send an invalid request
- When the API processes it
- Then I should receive a 400 Bad Request with error details
